intro: Palicourea dives, commonly known as the blue-eyed whiteface, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale blue, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Palicourea dives is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests.
